Indication: Broiler chickens - For the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria tenella ~ E. necatrix ~ E. acervulina ~ E. brunetti ~ E. mitis (mivati) ~ and E. maxima. Because diclazuril is effective against E. maxima later in its life cycle ~ subclinical intestinal lesions may be present for a short time after infection. Diclazuril was shown in studies to reduce lesion scores and improve performance and health of birds challenged with E. maxima.
Limitations: Feed continuously. Not for use in hens producing eggs for human food.

Indication: Broiler chickens - As in item (i) of this table ~ for increased rate of weight gain and improved feed efficiency.
Limitations: As in item (i) of this table. Bacitracin methylenedisalicylate provided by 054771.
